thread.title_full: No Doubt About It, Glendale Glitters During the...

title: No Doubt About It, Glendale Glitters During the...

organizations.name: raymond s. kellis high school dance company

text:
By Judy Hedding Updated December 04, 2016 . 
Once again the Glendale Glitters celebration in Historic Downtown Glendale, Arizona will host thousands visitors who will start the holiday season off in style. Glendale Glitters events will take place between Friday, November 25, 2016 and January 7, 2017. Holiday Light Display 
Historic Downtown Glendale comes to life each holiday season with the addition of about 1.5 million multi-colored twinkling LED holiday lights located throughout a 16-block area that includes the Old Towne and Catlin Court Districts. Arizona's Best Hometown Holiday tradition shines brightly from 5 to 10 p.m. all nights. Even if you come to Downtown Glendale when it isn't one of the special holiday weekends mentioned below, you can ooh! and ah! at the lights, buy gifts at one-of-a-kind shops, enjoy dinner or dessert, and take photos by the holiday tree. Glendale Glitters Spectacular Weekend 
November 25 and 26, 2016 from 5 to 10 p.m.What happens? Holiday entertainment, food, hand-crafted holiday gifts, a children's winter wonderland and petting zoo, shopping and, of course, visits with Santa. 
continue reading below our video Before Your Road Trip, Watch This The Countdown to Glendale Glitters on Friday evening, Nov. 25 begins at 5:30 p.m. for the lighting ceremony. Admission is free. 
Parking will be in short supply. Free shuttles will run from the Glendale Community College north parking lot, at 59th and Vogel Avenues, between 4:30 p.m. and 10:15 p.m. The last shuttle will leave downtown Glendale at 10:15 p.m. Event attendees will have the option of paying for preferred parking in the two downtown garages, located at City Hall, at 59th and Glenn Drive and the Bank of America Building, at 58th Avenue and Glenn Drive. Both garages should be accessed from 59 th Avenue. Jingle Bells Rockin' Nights 
Friday and Saturday, December 2 and 3, 2016 from 6 p.m. to 10 p.m.Downtown Glendale’s Murphy Park will be packed with music, lights and excitement. Entertainment will include performances of both holiday music and oldies you can dance to, as well as dance troupe performances. The event will also feature holiday arts and crafts, inflatable rides and visits with Santa Claus. Bring your camera, or have Santa’s helper snap one for a small fee. 
Entertainment lineup on the amphitheater stage:Friday:7 p.m. Michaela’s Dance Magic8 p.m. Danzarte Danza Folklorica9 p.m. Raymond S. Kellis High School Dance Company 
Saturday:6 p.m. Copper King Elementary Honor's Choir7 p.m. Bling Tour8 p.m. Heart and Sole Performing Arts9 p.m. Jataba Dance Troupe Winter Wonderland Weekend 
Friday and Saturday, December 9 and 10, 2016 from 6 p.m. to 10 p.m.A holiday movie will be showing nightly at 6:30 and 8:30 p.m., and other highlights include free make-and-take crafts, face-painting, Santa Claus and musical entertainment. 
Entertainment lineup:6 p.m. Innerlight Dance Center Lil' Lights Group7 p.m. Cannedy Performing Arts Centre8 p.m. The Dance Shoppe9 p.m. Arizona Twirling Athletes 6 p.m. Paula Carr Dance Academy7 p.m. Spotlight Entertainment Fine Arts Academy8 p.m. Center Stage Stars9 p.m. Aloha Hapa Hula Dance Production Spirit of Giving Weekend 
Friday and Saturday, December 16 and 17, 2016 from 6 p.m. to 10 p.m.Highlights include all the fun family activities that Glendale Glitters always brings, plus special celebration of and donation drives for worthy local charities. A family-friendly holiday movie shows nightly, plus make-and-take crafts, face-painting, Santa Claus and musical entertainment. 
Entertainment lineup:6 p.m. Prestige Dance Academy7 p.m. Dance Gallerie8 p.m. Glendale Union High School District Vocal Ensembles 
Saturday:6 p.m. Arizona Dance Artistry7 p.m. Lori Ford's Vocal Studio 8 p.m. Creative Edge Dance Studio 9 p.m. Trevor G. Browne Dance Company Where is it? 
Historic Downtown Glendale is located just east and north of 59th and Glendale Avenues. Here is a map with directions. This event is NOT accessible by Valley Metro Rail. 
Glendale is west of Phoenix. If you are driving from another community, here is an estimation of how long it will take you to get to Downtown Glendale . How much does it cost? 
There is no admission charge for Glendale Glitters events. What is the Glendale Glitter & Glow Block Party? 
Saturday, January 7, 2017 from 4 p.m. to 10 p.m.Admission is free. Thousands of people will stroll the sidewalks of Historic Downtown Glendale and watch about 20 tethered balloons gently expand as pilots fire them up, enjoying bands and street performers for a finale to a festive season. 
Due to the extensive street closures required for the block party, parking in the downtown area will be very limited. Event attendees will have the option of paying for preferred parking in the two downtown garages, located at City Hall, at 59th and Glendale Avenues and the Bank of America Building, at 58th Avenue and Glenn Drive. For those who like a free parking option, shuttles run all evening long, between 3:45 p.m. and 10:15 p.m. from Glendale Community College. Shuttles pick up from the northeast parking lots of the college. The last shuttle will leave downtown Glendale at 10:15 p.m. If you can find a spot, street parking in and around the downtown is free. What if I have more questions? 
You can visit City of Glendale online or call 623-930-2299 for more information. 
- - - - - - - - - - 
Tree lightings, holiday lights, festivals, holiday music and entertainment, gift guides and holiday travel tips -- find them all at the Christmas Holidays Guide for Greater Phoenix . 
All dates, times, prices and offerings are subject to change without notice.
